Title: Skeleton main.tex (no prose)
Description: Replace template brackets with outline headings and bullet placeholders aligned to the approved plan
Acceptance: Paper compiles; outline matches plan; no paragraph prose added

Title: Taxonomy + glossary sources
Description: Collect and verify sources for core families (diffusion/score/flow; token/AR/masked; GAN) and key building blocks (tokenizers; guidance; samplers)
Acceptance: At least 12 verified sources ready to cite; glossary/taxonomy terms are unambiguous

Title: Frontier timeline + primary sources
Description: Collect and verify primary sources for major releases (2020–2025) and their key technical deltas; track disclosure level (data/compute/license)
Acceptance: Timeline entries each have a primary source link (paper/tech report/model card) and date

Title: Benchmarks/metrics survey
Description: Collect and verify sources for common metrics and benchmark protocols (fidelity/diversity; alignment; preference eval; robustness/safety)
Acceptance: At least 10 verified sources; metrics table draft items listed in notes

Title: Safety + provenance survey
Description: Collect and verify sources for watermarking/provenance metadata/detection and policy context relevant to image generators
Acceptance: At least 10 verified sources; clear mapping of methods to threat models

Title: Seed ref.bib (verified)
Description: Create initial set of verified BibTeX entries (foundation + representative systems) with consistent citation keys
Acceptance: ref.bib contains >=15 verified entries; bibtex runs cleanly

Title: Introduction and scope
Description: Define scope and cutoff; summarize why modern diffusion + transformer backbones dominate; roadmap of sections
Acceptance: Section written with >=8 verified citations; claims are citation-backed; matches scope boundaries

Title: Foundations and building blocks
Description: Unifying view (objectives; conditioning; guidance); core components (tokenizers; backbones; samplers); brief history
Acceptance: Section written with >=10 verified citations; Fig 1 included and referenced; minimal math; clear definitions

Title: Diffusion models: DDPM to DiT/flow
Description: Training objectives; sampler/solver families; classifier-free guidance; U-Net vs transformer diffusion
Acceptance: Section written with >=12 verified citations; Fig 3 included; includes efficiency methods (solvers/distillation) with sources

Title: Autoregressive and token-based image generators
Description: Discrete latents; AR vs masked modeling; when token models win/lose vs diffusion; scaling and latency tradeoffs
Acceptance: Section written with >=10 verified citations; includes clear comparison points and limitations

Title: Conditioning, control, personalization, editing
Description: Conditioning inputs (layout/depth/pose/edges); ControlNet-style adapters; personalization (DreamBooth/LoRA); instruction editing
Acceptance: Section written with >=12 verified citations; Fig 4 included; discusses common failure modes (identity drift; leakage) with evidence
Notes: Separate control vs personalization vs editing

Title: Frontier systems and practical tradeoffs
Description: Representative frontier/open systems; disclosure/reproducibility; quality-speed-control tradeoffs; deployment constraints
Acceptance: Section written with >=10 verified citations; Fig 2 + Tab 1 included; table rows each have a primary source
Notes: Clearly label closed vs open claims

Title: Evaluation, benchmarks, and failure modes
Description: Metrics and benchmark design; preference-based eval; failure modes (bias; prompt sensitivity; memorization); reporting recommendations
Acceptance: Section written with >=10 verified citations; Tab 2 included; limitations of each metric are stated with sources

Title: Safety, provenance, and open problems
Description: Misuse/copyright/privacy; watermarking and provenance metadata; detection limits; open problems and best practices
Acceptance: Section written with >=8 verified citations; clear distinction between evidence and open questions
Notes: Tie provenance to realistic threat models

Title: Abstract, keywords, and conclusion
Description: Write abstract (no citations); finalize keywords; conclusion that summarizes takeaways without new claims
Acceptance: Abstract 150–250 words; conclusion introduces no new uncited claims; paper reads coherently end-to-end
Notes: Do after core sections are stable

Title: Citations: 100% verified
Description: Verify every cited claim has a matching entry in ref.bib and that entries match the source metadata
Acceptance: No placeholder entries; every BibTeX entry has a verified URL/DOI/arXiv id; Verified_Citations equals Target_Citations total

Title: Compile cleanly (latexmk)
Description: Run full compile; ensure no LaTeX errors and no undefined citations/references
Acceptance: latexmk exits 0; no 'Citation undefined' warnings; main.pdf produced

Title: Layout sanity
Description: Check for overfull boxes and two-column fit; fix wide figures/tables; ensure readable fonts
Acceptance: No 'Overfull \\hbox' warnings; figures/tables fit columns; captions are self-contained

Title: Figure/table integrity
Description: Verify every figure/table is referenced, captioned, and sourced if externally derived
Acceptance: All floats referenced in text; no missing files; any reused assets have citations

Title: Consistency + terminology
Description: Check acronyms, naming, and section cross-references; ensure consistent definitions across the paper
Acceptance: Acronyms defined on first use; consistent naming for models/metrics; no contradictory claims

Title: Final polish
Description: Tighten prose, remove redundancy, and ensure conclusion matches evidence; final pass for arXiv readiness
Acceptance: Paper is concise; no uncited factual claims; final PDF is submission-ready
